body_html:
@p-morais 0.2.0 has some breaking changes that can be detected if you insert a piece of code to the top of your scripts. Warnings will be generated in such cases. We've put this in the 0.2.0 release notes, in the mailing list etc.
The breaking changes are due to introduction of broadcasting, and changing the way dimensions are collapsed during reductions (and making them consistent with numpy)

I'd urge you to check if your code is affected by these changes. Instructions are in the release notes here:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases/tag/v0.2.0
See the "Important Breakages and Workarounds" section.

let us know if that does not fix your issue, and we can investigate further.

I'd urge you to check if your code is affected by these changes. Instructions are in the release notes here:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases/tag/v0.2.0
See the "Important Breakages and Workarounds" section.
let us know if that does not fix your issue, and we can investigate further.
body:
@p-morais 0.2.0 has some breaking changes that can be detected if you insert a piece of code to the top of your scripts. Warnings will be generated in such cases. We've put this in the 0.2.0 release notes, in the mailing list etc.
The breaking changes are due to introduction of broadcasting, and changing the way dimensions are collapsed during reductions (and making them consistent with numpy)

I'd urge you to check if your code is affected by these changes. Instructions are in the release notes here:
https://github.com/pytorch/pytorch/releases/tag/v0.2.0
See the "Important Breakages and Workarounds" section.

let us know if that does not fix your issue, and we can investigate further.
